item.title: Rubbish along palace grove on the pavement and road, 11th December
item.description:
Palace grove is an extension the high street but not treated to the same cleaning regime. As it is a back road it is forgotten and this is always worse after the weekend or after the rubbish has been collected. As the collectors throw more over the road than in the back of the lorry. I am really fed up of your service and will report higher if this carries on.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Palace Grove, Plaistow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No cleaning taking place, 11th December
item.description:
The road and gully’s have not been cleaned in forever and the vehicle that cleans the road always fails to come and when they do come they blame the parked cars. Maybe come when you see it’s clear or sweep it

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Arnside Street, Walworth, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fallen Fruit Causing Dangerous Walkway, 11th December
item.description:
A lot of fruit has fallen from this tree and the one a couple of houses up from this one. It is causing a serious trip hazard and needs to be cleaned urgently as people are slipping all the time when walking on the path. It has been like this for a number of weeks now if not longer and the rain has not cleaned it away at all.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 79, Grasmere Road, Barnehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: “Kelly Avenue” street sign is illegible, 11th December
item.description:
The “Kelly Avenue” street sign on the corner near the Lister Primary Care Centre is completely faded and unreadable. In the last week graffiti has also been sprayed on this. Please can the street sign be replaced - thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 101, Peckham Road, Peckham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Planning application web site comment button missing again, 11th December
item.description:
On the Haringey Planning view planning applications web site comment button missing (again). 1. check ask staff to test after each posting as on going issue. 2. Please try to fix. 3. add planning objection before 05/1/2026 for HGY/2025/3173 31 Beaconsfield Road, Tottenham, London, N15 4SH. Proposal Replacement of the existing timber entrance front door with new modern style door. Objection is that the new door should be in Late Victorian Style not modern. I.e 4 panels 2 upper and 2 lower. Conservation Area.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beaconsfield Road, West Green, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Waste bags for collection, 11th December
item.description:
A litter pick was carried out at the weekend and 14 bags of rubbish were picked up. These are on Glenbrook South waiting collection. Please could they be picked up before animals and the weather open them up again?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cotswold Way, Greater London

item.title: Cars parked on both sides of the road causing dangerous driving., 11th December
item.description:
Woolwich Road, Belvedere, Numbers 73, 71, 69 and 67 on one side and Numbers 106, 104, 102 and 100 on the other side. This is a very narrow part of Woolwich Road with an Island in place as well. For about a month now cars are parking on both sides of the road causing congestion and accidents where cars are not giving way. The house at No. 73 seems to have a lot of cars which is adding to the issue. You have recently put double yellow lines further up Woolwich Road by the entry to Abbey Woods and I think this stretch of road needs them also.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 75, Woolwich Road, Upper Belvedere, Bexleyheath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
